text: In Greek mythology, Prothoenor (Ancient Greek: Προθοήνωρ) was one of the Greek leaders in the Trojan War, from Thespiae in Boeotia, son of AreilycusHomer, Iliad, 2. 495Diodorus Siculus, Library of History, 4. 67. 7 and TheobuleHyginus, Fabulae, 97, brother of Arcesilaus; he commanded eight ships. John Tzetzes makes him a son of Alector and Arteis, and thus a half-brother of Leitus and Clonius.Tzetzes, Allegoriae Iliadis, Prologue, 535 According to the Iliad, he was killed by Polydamas, who immediately began to boast about it.Homer, Iliad, 14. 450-455 ==References== Category:Achaean Leaders Category:Characters in Greek mythology
title: Prothoenor
